meanings.definition: A thin, soft flatbread popular in Middle Eastern cuisine.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat lavash with hummus.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served delicious falafel wrapped in lavash.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sandwich go to the bakery? To get a fresh lavash outfit!
meanings.sent4: The warm lavash hugged the filling like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked lavash filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To wrap or roll food in lavash bread.
meanings.sent1: She decided to lavash the grilled vegetables for a tasty wrap.
meanings.sent2: They always lavash their kebabs in soft bread before serving.
meanings.sent3: Why did the burrito refuse to be wrapped in lavash? It was on a roll!
meanings.sent4: The chef lavashed the ingredients together with precision.
meanings.sent5: As the party approached, she hurried to lavash the appetizers for the guests.
